intro: Metabolos auricularius, commonly known as the ear-shaped leaf plant, is a unique species characterized by its distinctive auricle-like leaves. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae and is native to the mountainous regions of South America. Its leaves are broad, lobed, and often curl inward, resembling small ears, which gives it its common name. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories.
